committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Elementary, Secondary, and Vocational Education
Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: Declaring the sense of Congress regarding periods of silence in the public schools.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) the Constitution does not preclude a short period of silence to be used, solely at the discretion of the individual student in public schools, for silent prayer, meditation, contemplation, or introspection; and (2) public school authorities should recognize the value of such a short period.

titles.title: Declaring the sense of Congress regarding periods of silence in the public schools.
